p: Albano et al. [ 14] reported the AChE inhibition activity of T. mastichina essential oil for the first time, with IC 50 values of 45.8 Î¼g/mL related to the 1,8-cineole constituent. However, the assessment of decoction water extracts was not possible for AChE inhibition capacity. Aazza et al. [ 40] also reported AChE inhibition activity of T. mastichina essential oil but poor activity was observed (IC 50 of 0.1 mg/mL), despite the fact that the main constituent was also 1,8-cineole.
